definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: Should I look older just to be put on your shelf?
sentences.chinese: 我是否應該讓自己看上去老態龍鍾好讓你放下呢？

sentences.english: Not knowing their own flaws is already doddering attitude.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知自身漏洞百出早已呈老態龍鍾之態。

sentences.english: In the Guangzhou Zoo I saw a South China tiger in its doddering old age.
sentences.chinese: 在廣州動物園我看見一隻老態龍鍾的華南虎。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
